recipes: It still lingers in my memories - a wildly different Mansus, where the Serpent was king.
[Currently, this will only give you a small part of all the things we have in store.]
Read an old Book of Lies

This would truly be an awful introduction to the Secret Arts for not a single word of it contains truth. Quite possibly, it is deliberate misinformation. Or worse, a cognitohazard. Or worse, a book of the Tail. Nevertheless...

In the beginning there was the Sun-of-Blood and the Haruspex. Seeking her greatest augury, the Haruspex slew the Sun... Curious stories, entertaining stories, but untrue stories. But one can learn as much from what is not as from what is...

This would truly be an awful introduction to the Secret Arts for not a single word of it contains truth. Quite possibly, it is deliberate misinformation. Or worse, a cognitohazard. Or worse, a book of the Tail. Nevertheless...

The whispers of Hours that are not are no less insiduous than those that are. Perhaps you do not want to read the dire details of the rites used to splinter the Soot-Furnace. Yet it twists and turns and coils and winds and my mind my mind my mind!

In the beginning there was the Sun-of-Blood and the Haruspex. Seeking her greatest augury, the Haruspex slew the Sun... Dire stories, awful stories, but fortunately, fortunately untrue stories and incomplete stories, the book is damaged. One can learn as much from what is not as from what is, as much as it hurts...

The whispers of Hours that are not are no less thunderous than those that are. The details of the Haruspex's prophecy still echo in your mind. It twists and turns and coils and winds but not painfully.

The Haruspex brought her prophecy to the people of the world and held it aloft as their annihilation... in a field that sounds oddly familiar. Curious stories, odd stories, but untrue stories and incomplete stories, the book is damaged. Still, one can learn as much from what is not as from what is.
The whispers of Hours that are not are no less wondrous than those that are. The deeds of the Serpent-that-Shattered, the stranger who defied the prophecies still ring triumphantly in your mind.

That which came from Nowhere was crushed in its coils. The Histories, even the History of the Mansus, was shattered, but the Serpent smiled and rose to rebuild the world. Awesome stories, magnificent stories, but sadly untrue stories and incomplete stories, the book is damaged. Still, can learn as much from what is not as from what is.
Summon an impervious creature of the Tower of Treasures
The Jaded Maiden! She might be as old as the first Hours, or she might measure her age in seconds. She will answer to Lantern, for what she had seen, and Heart, for what she had survived.
The Maiden would be very easily mistaken for a statue, if statues were ever made with such detail (or with such verdant nephrite). She is quite content to stay like this.
The Maidens don't struggle much, they just go with the flow.
The Way to the Mirage Door
The Mirage Door is not closed, but guarded.

The Mirage Door, occasionally called the Formless Door or the Eye’s Gate, is not closed, but guarded. 'You will have to best yourself to pass through the Mirage Door.' - chimes the Door's guardian as it copies my every feature. 'You cannot best yourself.'
I have to best myself to pass through the Mirage Door. I cannot best myself.

There are rules to the Mirage Door: If I show my reflection a mirror, it will be obliged to fight that reflection, just as I am obliged to fight it. I will pass the Door in the commotion, but my mirror will not remain whole.
There are rules to the Mirage Door: If I forget what I am, nothing will stand to oppose me. I only need to close my eyes and walk.

An infamous octet of reputed immortals once came to this place in search of treasure from behind the world’s skin. The Long remain here to this day, alongside the miracles they discovered. [Expeditions need at least one Funds per obstacle. Followers will defeat obstacles. If you run out of Funds or Followers, the Expedition ends.]

Nothing stands between us and the treasured gardens of Hourai. The mendicant Tieguai warns us that we may only take a single peach from the trees, lest we anger the Eye-Closed. The necromancer Guolao indicates that no such rules apply to the treasures strewn in the white grass.

Guolao takes a bone, or merely a bone-white stone, and chucks it at one of the trees. A branch breaks off and lands upon the grass. 'You can take it with you, alongside what you’ve been promised. Just leave some treasure for us, friend!' The taste of the crystal peach had refined my body into something durable and vital. I am more than I was. I will never forget that bleached land.
The location's pristine and jaded servants have gathered to stop you. They cannot be persuaded in the same way stone cannot be persuaded, but they may be broken by Edge or Forge.
Funds are essential for expeditions. Followers will allow me to pass obstacles.
The Servants are advisors, oracles and courtiers. Their kind is not meant to fight. We have slain faster, stronger opponents. These living sculptures stand no chance of stopping us.
The Jaded Servants were human, once. A little of that humanity remains, hidden beneath their nephrite. We can strike at that humanity like a viper, but they may defeat us before we get the chance.
Our strength may not be enough.
Each Servant had once been human, and each Servant had rejected their humanity for a life of brilliance. Each one could crush us in her vice grip, if she so chose. Still, we may have a chance.
We call upon the Snake-Tail, who tears at the skin of the world.
The Jaded Servants had locked away their humanity in order to become statuesque nephrite. The Snake-Tail, who shatters doors, will be happy to shatter his way to their very core.
We call upon the Snake-Tail, who has shattered a million doors.
The Jaded Servants are statues before they are people. They move with the grandiose rhythm of tectonic plates. The Tail had shattered things greater than tectonic plates, but not much greater.
We call upon the Snake-Tail, who despises all borders.
Their bodies may be whole, but they no longer live. Our finesse has secured us the vay forward.
Only jewel-shards remain where the Jaded Servants once stood. We had won our way forward.

The Jaded Servants first negotiate, then prevaricate, then deceive, then chant mantras, then shout invocations, but never strike. Their clever words have repelled us, and have taken root in our minds besides.
